Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of two faded bands; exterior: part of guilloche pattern in handle zone above a brown band; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The guilloche pattern is a typical motif found on Mature Animal Style and Grand Style chalices. Furthermore, as is typical with both styles, the handle zone is not bulbous as it is in earlier styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0661) (phase 2)
